meanings.definition: To change the position or order of things.
meanings.sent1: I will rearrange the books on the shelf to make them look neater.
meanings.sent2: She likes to rearrange her room every few months for a fresh look.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous elf decided to rearrange the furniture in the house while everyone was asleep.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were like puzzle pieces that she needed to rearrange to find the solution.
meanings.sent5: The magician could rearrange the cards in a blink of an eye, leaving the audience amazed.

meanings.sent1: Let's rearrange the schedule to fit in more time for breaks.
meanings.sent2: She had to rearrange the flowers in the vase to create a more balanced arrangement.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to rearrange the ingredients after realizing she forgot a key element.
meanings.sent4: The words in the poem seemed to rearrange themselves into a beautiful verse.
meanings.sent5: The students were asked to rearrange themselves in alphabetical order for the class photo.

meanings.definition: To adjust or move things around.
meanings.sent1: He needed to rearrange the furniture in the living room to make space for the new TV.
meanings.sent2: The teacher asked the students to rearrange their desks into a circle for group work.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to rearrange the nuts in its stash to make them more organized.
meanings.sent4: The wind seemed to rearrange the fallen leaves into intricate patterns on the ground.
meanings.sent5: She had to rearrange her plans when unexpected guests arrived at her doorstep.
